The truly easiest way to pay your friends (and get paid) now works with iOS 11. We also fixed a couple of things to make Venmo prettier.

We want you to be in control of what you share and with whom, so we’ve tweaked some of our privacy settings.

And the app should be even smoother than before. Our best version yet!

All that stuff that you love about Halloween now as emoji—skulls, candy corn, magic tricks.
And we also took the opportunity to make Venmo a bit prettier.

Venmo’s ready for our favorite autumn to-do—Black Friday and holiday shopping.
Use Venmo on your phone to buy things from millions (!!) of retailers where you see the PayPal button. Seriously, it’s never too early for holiday presents. And it’s never been easier—no more “it didn’t arrive?” excuses.

November is packed with the awesome stuff to keep you cozy and safe—pumpkin-spiced lattes and two-factor authentication. Venmo also got its flu-shot, so there are now even less bugs floating around.

’Tis the season of giving. And in our last release of 2017, we’re giving you a few new festive emoji. We’ve also wrapped up Face ID and a better way to shop with Venmo… with a bow on top.

We’re starting 2018 slowly with just a few fixes and a bit of polishing. But we’re keeping our New Year’s resolution… more time in the gym and feature-packed releases.

Few things we’ve got up our sleeves this time:
· Instant Transfer is now a thing and for $0.25, you can transfer your Venmo balance to any supported debit card in minutes.
· For international couples day, Lunar New Year, and that big sports game, we got a few emoji surprises for you.
· And for the privacy concerned, we made our privacy settings a bit easier. Check it out!
(Almost one month in and we’re still on track with our New-Year’s resolution. Wow!)

You got enough privacy-policy emails in the last couple weeks. So, we aren’t doing that (at least not with this release).

But if your credit or debit card expires when you want to pay with Venmo, it’s now much easier to update it—right during checkout. Oh, and we also made a few tweaks to our privacy education.

Today, we're giving you more ways than ever to use Venmo. Introducing Venmo card, a debit card for the real world.

With the Venmo card, you can use your Venmo balance in more places than just on Venmo. In fact, Venmo card can be used everywhere Mastercard® is accepted in the U.S.

The card is currently in limited release. Open the app to reserve your spot today.

In order to provide our iOS users with the best experience, this version, 7.41.1, will be the last version to support iOS 10.

We're also introducing Venmo Rewards, a program that offers automatic cash back when users pay with the Venmo card at some of their favorite retailers.

Venmo cardholders can now add funds to their Venmo balance from a linked bank account.
You can also split a purchase unevenly now, and include the tip amount upfront.
Other than that, we took care of some bugs, crashes, and other app annoyances.

Venmo cardholders can now set up Direct Deposit into their Venmo accounts. With Direct Deposit on Venmo, paychecks can show up in your account up to two days earlier* than your normal payday. Find your account & routing number today under Settings --> Direct Deposit.
